anime.description: In a futuristic world, the Nanorace, people whose genes contain nanomachines that grant them special abilities, are controlled and suffer prejudice from the Purerace of normal human beings. http://anidb.net/ch87574 [Beck], a legendary hunter with the power of Red Ash, aims to undergo the surgical procedure to become Purerace. Alongside the large yet timid mechanic http://anidb.net/ch87572 [Tyger], they use their parallel machine to fly to the old world, doing dangerous jobs. One day, they suddenly run into http://anidb.net/ch87569 [Call], a girl pursued by the duo of http://anidb.net/ch87570 [Safari] and http://anidb.net/ch87571 [Stripe]. Call, Beck, and Tyger together travel to the clockwork world. But Safari, Stripe, and their leader http://anidb.net/ch87573 [Deny], stubbornly pursue Call, and are finally in a position to make their attack on Beck and his friends. Source: ANN Note: This anime was funded through a http://anidb.net/cr46647 [Kickstarter] project that started on 04.07.2015 and reached its goal on the final day 03.08.2015 as a tie-in to game company Comcept`s Red Ash: The Indelible Legend game.

externalentity.identifier: 若手アニメーター育成プロジェクト#あにめたまご2017（2016年度）

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: Wakate Animator Ikusei Project
tag.description: The Young Animator Training Project is an annual project launched in 2010 and funded by the Japanese government`s Agency for Cultural Affairs. The project, which culminates in a series of shorts produced by various animation studios each year, means to address the concern that more of the Japanese animation process is being outsourced overseas, thus leading to a decline in opportunities to teach animation techniques within Japan. As such, the animation production for each short is required to be based in Japan, and professionals must impart their know-how to the young animators through on-the-job training. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.
